questions.question: I think they teach ..................... . mathematics in schools.
questions.description: Most words ending in –ics are normally singular uncountable nouns and have no plural use.

questions.question: ………………….. suffering from a disease called BSE.
questions.description: Cattle is a plural word and it has no singular.

questions.question: The police ..................... the thief.
questions.description: Police is normally used as a plural noun.

questions.question: Where ……………….. my glasses?
questions.description: Words like trousers, jeans, pants, scissors, glasses, binoculars etc., are plural.

questions.question: The organization is trying to raise ……………… to support its projects.
questions.description: When funds means money, it is used in the plural form.

questions.question: A number of people ..................... tried to find the treasure.
questions.description: The expression ‘a number of people’ is usually followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: A group of us …………….. going to hold a party tomorrow.
questions.description: The expression ‘a group of us’ is followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: Half of her students ……………… understand a word she says.
questions.description: Half of should be followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: Ten miles ………………. a long way to walk.
questions.description: We usually use singular verbs when we talk about amounts and quantities.

questions.question: One of my friends …………….. going to Mexico.
questions.description: One of is normally followed by a plural noun and a singular verb.

questions.question: Nobody ……………….. him except his best friends.
questions.description: Nobody is usually followed by a singular verb.
